title: Active-duty Boston police officer dies after more than 30 years with department, BPD says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Boston police officer Scott MacIsaac died from cancer after serving over 30 years, the Boston Police Department confirmed.
MacIsaac, diagnosed in 2025, joined BPD in 1995 and was most recently assigned to West Roxbury.
He was recognized for his bravery during the Boston Marathon bombings and other life-saving incidents.

title: Bruins’ Jeremy Swayman gets into goalie fight with Andrei Vasilevskiy in outdoor game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman and Andrei Vasilevskiy fought during the Bruins' outdoor game loss at Raymond James Stadium.
The fight began after a scuffle involving Swayman and Lightning forward Brandon Hagel in the second period.
Swayman finished with 41 saves in Boston's 6-5 shootout loss, both goalies received penalties for fighting.

title: Suspect charged with murder after mother and son shot to death in Fall River
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Arlington Cole, 54, charged with double murder and firearm possession after Fall River shooting.
Victims Elizabeth Almeida, 54, and Nicholas Almeida, 25, found dead on Barnes Street.
Cole was found on scene, dated Elizabeth Almeida, arraignment set for Monday.

title: Dozens rescued by N.H. fire officials after ski lift malfunctions in bitter cold
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nearly 60 people were rescued by New Hampshire fire officials after a ski lift malfunctioned at Dartmouth Skiway.
Fire departments from Lyme, Hanover, and Thetford coordinated a 90-minute rescue operation to bring stranded skiers to safety.
One person was taken to Dartmouth-Hitchcock Medical Center; others were checked and returned to the lodge without injuries.

title: Former Mass. state senator receives more prison time for fraud
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Former Mass. State Sen. Dean Tran, 50, sentenced to 11 additional months in federal prison for obstructing justice and false statements.
Tran pleaded guilty in December 2025 for lying about pandemic unemployment fraud, leading to his current and new sentences.
Tran faces multiple charges, including violating state ethics law and involvement in a gun theft incident in 2019.

title: Bruins’ Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month after scoring eight goals in January.
Boston Bruins acquired Minten from the Maple Leafs at last year's trade deadline.
Bruins miss two top-six centers, relying on young players with an average age of 21.6 in upcoming game.

title: 7 people are presumed dead after their Gloucester fishing boat sank. Here’s how they’ll be remembered.
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Seven crew members are presumed dead after the Lily Jean fishing boat sank off Gloucester's coast Friday morning.
The U.S. Coast Guard suspended search operations after covering 1,000 square miles; one unresponsive body was found.
The victims, including Captain Gus Sanfilippo, are remembered by family and community for their dedication and personal ties.

title: Bruins dress as colonial Patriots ahead of Stadium Series game in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins dressed as colonial-era Patriots for the Stadium Series game against the Tampa Bay Lightning.
The attire was a tribute to the New England Patriots, who are headed to Super Bowl LX.
The Bruins used Boston Costume to create unique outfits, incorporating historical and personal style elements.

title: Red Sox reportedly trade pitcher Jordan Hicks to White Sox
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Red Sox trade relief pitcher Jordan Hicks and prospect David Sandlin to the White Sox.
Boston receives minor league pitcher Gage Ziehl and sends cash to Chicago in salary move.
Hicks struggled with an 8.20 ERA in 18.2 innings for Red Sox in 2025.

title: Photos: Something in the Way music fest at Roadrunner, Day 1
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: The two-day 'Something in the Way' festival at Roadrunner features performances by two dozen indie bands.
Day 1 performances captured by photographer Ben Stas included The Hotelier, Angel Du$t, and Explosions in the Sky.
Bands such as Her New Knife, Graham Hunt, and Momma entertained crowds at the festival's first day.
